events.name: Josh Long Night - Reactive Spring
events.description: We are extremely excited to have world-renowned Spring Developer Advocate, Java Champion, author and open source contributor, Josh Long speak at our joint Spring and Cloud Foundry Meetup. Abstract Spring 5 is almost here! One of the most exciting introductions in this release is support for reactive programming, building on the Pivotal Reactor project to support message-driven, elastic, resilient and responsive services. Spring 5 integrates an MVC-like component model adapted to support reactive processing and a new type of web endpoint, functional reactive endpoints.  In this talk, we'll look at the net-new Netty-based web runtime, how existing Servlet code can run on the new world, and how to integrate it with existing Spring-stack technologies.  Programme  6.30pm - 7.00pm  Registration and Pizzas 7.00pm - 7.20pm  CI That Scales With Your Project 7.20pm - 9.00pm  Josh Long - Reactive Spring  Venue Paypal Office @ Suntec Tower Five5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, Singapore[masked]Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line) In order for us to clear building security, please help to fill up this form after you RSVP on meetup. When you arrive, please take Lift 1 to level 16.  About Josh Long Josh is the Spring Developer Advocate at Pivotal. Josh is a Java Champion, author of 5 books (including O’Reilly’s upcoming Cloud Native Java: Designing Resilient Systems with Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, and Cloud Foundry) and 3 best-selling video trainings (including Building Microservices with Spring Boot Livelessons with Spring Boot co-founder Phil Webb), and an open-source contributor (Spring Boot, Spring Integration, Spring Cloud, Activiti and Vaadin)  Books Written By Josh Long Cloud Native Java: Designing Resilient Systems with Spring Boot, Spring Cloud, and Cloud Foundry Getting Started with Roo Spring Recipes: A Problem-Solution Approach Spring Enterprise Recipes: A Problem-Solution Approach Pro Spring Integration Recent Articles By Josh Long The Spring Blog Josh Long’s Blog Building “Bootiful”­ Microservices with Spring Cloud by Josh Long Recent Interview With Josh Long By InfoQ Josh Long on Spring Boot, Spring Cloud and Microservices
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: #4 - Designer's Journey - From Neuroscience to Chemistry
events.description:
#4 - Designer's Journey - From Neuroscience to Chemistry When you form a team with designers from various backgrounds where diversity is welcomed, you get to learn so much from each other. There is no rock star in collaborative design, that the best design can be crafted by the collaborative effort.  This meetup, I'll be inviting two unique, talented designers - Chinwei Wong, a Chemistry major now working as a Product Designer at a startup in the Silicon Valley and Anthony Tham, an Executive Creative Director specialising in Neuroscience Advertising - to tell their stories. As consumers ourselves we would like to think our decisions are entirely rational, at least most of the time. Anthony will talk about how our unconscious desires impact our decisions to buy. Chinwei will share his experience living, working and designing in San Francisco. Agenda:  • Opening Intro - Julee, Organiser of Design Bootcamp Asia • Adding Neuroscience to Magic - Anthony Tham, Executive Creative Director of Hogarth  • Journey from Chemistry to Design - Chinwei Wong, Incoming Product Designer at Boomerang Commerce, based in Silicon Valley.  • Q&A and Dialogue • Network time :) Please bring your friends, and colleagues, and have them join this meetup first and RSVP! 


Speaker Bio:  Anthony Tham is the Executive Creative Director at Hogarth. Born Gen-Y, but with the skillset of a Digital Native. During his 15 years in the advertising industry across ASEAN and Greater China, he had amassed experiences on clients across categories such as banking, government, telecommunications, FMCG, fashion and health. For the past five years, he had been on a ludicrous mission to fuse “magic with science”—by combining behavioural science with advertising, especially in the digital interconnected world. 


 Chin Wei is an incoming product designer at Boomerang Commerce, based in Mountain View, California. He graduated with a Masters in Human-Computer Interaction from Carnegie Mellon, and in a previous life built web experiences for clients regionally and further abroad.
events.location: WPP Building, 50 Scotts Road, Training Room, Ground Floor, Singapore 228242
